bug.author: xrmx
bug.summary: doc.print_tree deprecation warnings points to wrong method
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>>>> doc.print_tree() Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "doc.pyx", line 930, in spacy.tokens.doc.Doc.print_tree ValueError: [E105] The Doc.print_tree() method is now deprecated. Please use Doc.json() instead. >>> doc.json() Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> AttributeError: 'spacy.tokens.doc.Doc' object has no attribute 'json' </denchmark-code>
doc.to_json() works fine :) <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.1.0a6 Platform: Linux-4.19.0-1-amd64-x86_64-with-debian-buster-sid Python version: 3.7.2 Models: en_core_web_sm, it_core_news_sm

comments.comment: Thans â€“ that's definitly a typo! Actually, we might re-add Doc.print_tree in 2.1.x, because the new Doc.to_json likely won't cover everything that print_tree does.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
